programme.title: Premier League: Best Goals 2004/05
programme.desc: A look back at the best goals from the 2004/05 season. Thierry Henry won the Golden Boot for the second season running, with Crystal Palace's Andy Johnson coming a close second.

programme.title: Premier League: Best Goals 2005/06
programme.desc: A look back at the best goals from the 2005/06 season. Thierry Henry became the first player in the league's history to win the Golden Boot four times, top-scoring with 27 goals.

programme.title: Premier League: Best Goals 2006/07

programme.title: Premier League: Best Goals 2007/08

programme.title: Premier League: Best Goals 2008/09

programme.title: Premier League: Best Goals 2009/10

programme.title: Premier League: Best Goals 2010/11
programme.desc: A look back at the best goals from the 2010/2011 season. Dimitar Berbatov and Carlos Tevez shared the Golden Boot with 20 goals, ahead of Robin van Persie who finished with 18.

programme.title: Premier League: Best Goals 2011/12
programme.desc: A look back at the best goals from the 2011/12 season. With 30 goals, Robin van Persie won the Golden Boot in his final season for Arsenal, finishing three ahead of Wayne Rooney.

programme.title: Premier League: Best Goals 2012/13
programme.desc: A look back at the top strikes from the 2012/13 season. Robin van Persie finished top of the charts with 26 goals, three ahead of Luis Suarez and five in front of Gareth Bale.
